name: Speek Notifications
tagline: An Android app which reads information about unread notifications when you cover the proximity sensor.
body:
**Speek Notifications** is an Android application which reads notification information when you cover the proximity sensor. A synthesised voice (Using [CereVoice Cloud](https://www.cereproc.com/products/cloud)) tells you how many new messages, unread emails and missed calls you have.

![Speek Notifications screenshot.](http://euanfreeman.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2014/04/Screenshot_2014-04-06-16-59-01-e1396801450863.png)

Before compiling and installing Speek you'll have to create a free account to use [CereVoice Cloud](https://www.cereproc.com/products/cloud). Then put your Account ID and Password in the [CereCloudPlayer](https://github.com/efreeman/Speek-Notifications/blob/master/app/src/main/java/uk/co/euanfreeman/speek/voice/CereCloudPlayer.java) class.

Speek uses the proximity sensor to detect your hand and checks to make sure your phone is on a flat surface. This means Speek doesn't run while your phone is in your pocket.
